00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Functions for bit-banged SPI protocol.
00031  *
00032  * This code must be linked with either the FTDI D2XX library (@e FTD2XX.lib)
00033  * from http://www.ftdichip.com or the libusb library (@e libusb.a) from
00034  * http://libusb-win32.sourceforge.net/
00035  *
00036  * To use D2XX, define @c FTDI_USE_D2XX.
00037  *
00038  * To use libusb, define @c FTDI_USE_LIBUSB. The libftdi API is used to access
00039  * libusb, and the file @e ftdi.c should be compiled and linked also.
00040  *
00041  * References:
00042  *  - FTDI, FT232R Datasheet.
00043  *  - FTDI, D2XX Programmer's Guide.
00044  *  - FTDI, AN232R-01 Bit Bang Modes for the FT232R and FT245R.
00045  *  - libftdi API docs:
00046  *    http://www.intra2net.com/en/developer/libftdi/documentation/
00047  *
00048  * @file ftSpi.c
00049  * @date 27-Jan-2010
00050  * @author Se√°n Harte
00051  ******************************************************************************/

00055 #include <stdlib.h>

00058 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00059 #   include <windows.h>
00060 #   include "ftd2xx.h"
00061 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)

00069 /** Active low pin to enable analogue switch for SPI. **/
00070 #define PROG_EN             0x80
00071 
00072 /** Bit bang mode to use on FT232R (4 = synchronous, 1 = asynchronous). **/
00073 #define BIT_BANG_MODE       0x04
00074 
00075 /** Vendor ID for Tyndall programing boards (FTDI default) */
00076 #define VENDOR_ID           0x0403
00077 
00078 /** Product ID for Tyndall programing boards (FTDI default) */
00079 #define PRODUCT_ID          0x6001
00080 
00081 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00082     /**
00083      * Largest value that can be used in FT_Write() and FT_Read() functions.
00084      * Writes and reads were tested and found to fail at around 38000 bytes. Not
00085      * sure why this is...
00086      **/
00087 #   define MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE    15000
00088 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00089     /**
00090      * Largest value that can be used in the ftdi_write_data() function. Larger
00091      * values fail with error: "LIBUSB_DLL: error: usb_reap: timeout error"
00092      * Not sure why this is...
00093      **/
00094 #   define MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE    384
00095 #endif
00096 
00097 /** How long to wait if something is not responding (in seconds). **/
00098 #define TIMEOUT             1
00099 
00100 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00101 /** Used to convert error codes to strings. **/
00102 static const char* ftErrorStrings[] = {"FT_OK", "FT_INVALID_HANDLE",
00103         "FT_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND", "FT_DEVICE_NOT_OPENED", "FT_IO_ERROR",
00104         "FT_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES", "FT_INVALID_PARAMETER",
00105         "FT_INVALID_BAUD_RATE", "FT_DEVICE_NOT_OPENED_FOR_ERASE",
00106         "FT_DEVICE_NOT_OPENED_FOR_WRITE", "FT_FAILED_TO_WRITE_DEVICE",
00107         "FT_EEPROM_READ_FAILED", "FT_EEPROM_WRITE_FAILED",
00108         "FT_EEPROM_ERASE_FAILED", "FT_EEPROM_NOT_PRESENT",
00109         "FT_EEPROM_NOT_PROGRAMMED", "FT_INVALID_ARGS", "FT_NOT_SUPPORTED",
00110         "FT_OTHER_ERROR"};
00111 #endif
00112 
00113 /** Handle used to access FT device by all functions in this file. **/
00114 static void* ftHandle = NULL;
00115 
00116 /** Only close connection if it has been opened */
00117 static bool isFtInit = false;
00118 
00119 
00120 /* Pins used for SPI communications. **/
00121 static uint8_t ncs;
00122 static uint8_t sck;
00123 static uint8_t miso;
00124 static uint8_t mosi;
00125 
00126 /* Local function prototypes. **/
00127 static void serialiseMosi(const uint8_t* bytes, uint8_t* serialData,
00128                           uint32_t size);
00129 static bool deserialiseMiso(const uint8_t* serialData, uint8_t* bytes,
00130                             uint32_t size);
00131 static void bitBang(const uint8_t* writeData, uint8_t* readData, uint32_t size);
00132 static void bitBangBlock(const uint8_t* writeData, uint8_t* readData,
00133                          uint32_t size);
00134 static void checkFtError(int32_t code, const char* location);

00141 
00142 void ftSpi_init(spiDeviceInfo_t* device)
00143 {
00144     int32_t status;
00145     uint8_t direction;
00146 
00147     /* Store pins to use for SPI communication */
00148     ncs = device->ncs;      /* active low chip select */
00149     sck = device->sck;      /* clock */
00150     miso = device->miso;    /* Master In, Slave Out */
00151     mosi = device->mosi;    /* Master Out, Slave In */
00152 
00153     /* These pins will be outputs */
00154     direction = PROG_EN | ncs | sck | mosi;
00155 
00156 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00157     /* Compares descriptions and opens device if description matches */
00158     if (FT_OK != FT_OpenEx((PVOID)device->description,
00159                            FT_OPEN_BY_DESCRIPTION,
00160                            &ftHandle)) {
00161         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not connect to %s Board.\n"
00162                 "       Check USB connection, power switch, and if another program is \n"
00163                 "       communicating with the board through the virtual COM Port.\n",
00164                 device->description);
00165         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00166     }
00167     printf(" Board Found (%s).\n", device->description);
00168 
00169     isFtInit = true;
00170 
00171     /* Set speed that data changes at */
00172     status = FT_SetBaudRate(ftHandle, device->baudRate);
00173     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00174 
00175     /* Set synchronous bit-bang mode */
00176     status = FT_SetBitMode(ftHandle, direction, BIT_BANG_MODE);
00177     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00178 
00179     /* Purge RX and TX buffers, just in case there's some data there */
00180     status = FT_Purge(ftHandle, FT_PURGE_RX | FT_PURGE_TX);
00181     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00182 
00183     /* Set timeouts */
00184     status = FT_SetTimeouts(ftHandle, TIMEOUT * 1000, TIMEOUT * 1000);
00185     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00186 
00187     /* Set lower latency for faster operation */
00188 //    status = FT_SetLatencyTimer(ftHandle, 2);
00189 //    checkFtError(status, LOC);
00190 
00191 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00192     if (NULL == (ftHandle = ftdi_new())) {
00193         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not connect to %s Board.\n"
00194                 "       Check USB connection, power switch, and if another program is \n"
00195                 "       communicating with the board through the virtual COM Port.\n",
00196                 device->description);
00197         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00198     }
00199 
00200     if (0 > ftdi_usb_open_desc(ftHandle, VENDOR_ID, PRODUCT_ID,
00201                                                    device->description, NULL)) {
00202         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not connect to %s Board.\n"
00203                 "       Check USB connection, power switch, and if another program is \n"
00204                 "       communicating with the board through the virtual COM Port.\n",
00205                 device->description);
00206         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00207     }
00208 
00209     printf(" Board Found (%s).\n", device->description);
00210 
00211     /* Set speed that data changes at */
00212     status = ftdi_set_baudrate(ftHandle, device->baudRate);
00213     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00214 
00215     /* Set synchronous bit-bang mode TODO */
00216     status = ftdi_set_bitmode(ftHandle, direction, BITMODE_SYNCBB);
00217     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00218 
00219     /* Purge RX and TX buffers, just in case there's some data there */
00220     status = ftdi_usb_purge_buffers(ftHandle);
00221     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00222 
00223     /* Set lower latency for faster operation */
00224     status = ftdi_set_latency_timer(ftHandle, 2);
00225     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00226 
00227     /* Enable debugging messages for libusb */
00228     usb_set_debug(255);
00229 #endif
00230 }
00231 
00232 
00233 void ftSpi_readWrite(uint8_t* misoData, const uint8_t* mosiData,
00234                      uint32_t count, bool chipSelect)
00235 {
00236     uint8_t* outSpi;
00237     uint8_t* inSpi;
00238     uint32_t bufferSize = count * 16 + 4;
00239 
00240     if (count == 0) {
00241         return;                  /* Nothing to do */
00242     }
00243 
00244     outSpi = (uint8_t*)malloc(bufferSize);
00245     inSpi = (uint8_t*)malloc(bufferSize);
00246     if (outSpi == NULL || inSpi == NULL) {
00247         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00248                 bufferSize, LOC);
00249         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00250     }
00251 
00252     if (chipSelect) {
00253         outSpi[0] = ncs;
00254         outSpi[bufferSize - 1] = ncs;
00255     }
00256     else {
00257         outSpi[0] = 0;
00258         outSpi[bufferSize - 1] = 0;
00259     }
00260     outSpi[1] = 0;
00261     outSpi[bufferSize - 2] = 0;
00262 
00263     /* Generate SPI stream to send out */
00264     serialiseMosi(mosiData, outSpi + 2, count);
00265 
00266     /* Send and receive the data */
00267     bitBang(outSpi, inSpi, bufferSize);
00268 
00269     if (misoData != NULL) {
00270         /* Decode data that was read back from EEPROM */
00271         if (!deserialiseMiso(inSpi + 2, misoData, bufferSize - 4)) {
00272             fprintf(stderr,
00273                     "ERROR: SPI communications failed when sending %u bytes\n"
00274                     "       Check USB connection and power switch.\n", count);
00275             free(inSpi);
00276             free(outSpi);
00277             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00278         }
00279         free(inSpi);
00280     }
00281     free(outSpi);
00282 }
00283 
00284 
00285 void ftSpi_enableChipSelect(void)
00286 {
00287     uint8_t outSpi[2];
00288     uint8_t inSpi[2];
00289 
00290     /* Bring nCS low at start of SPI data */
00291     outSpi[0] = ncs;
00292     outSpi[1] = 0;
00293 
00294     bitBang(outSpi, inSpi, 2);
00295 }
00296 
00297 
00298 void ftSpi_disableChipSelect(void)
00299 {
00300     uint8_t outSpi[2];
00301     uint8_t inSpi[2];
00302 
00303     /* Bring nCS high at end of SPI data */
00304     outSpi[0] = 0;
00305     outSpi[1] = ncs;
00306 
00307     bitBang(outSpi, inSpi, 2);
00308 }
00309 
00310 
00311 void ftSpi_close(void)
00312 {
00313     if (isFtInit) {
00314 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00315         FT_Purge(ftHandle, FT_PURGE_RX | FT_PURGE_TX);
00316         FT_SetBitMode(ftHandle, 0, 0);
00317         FT_Close(ftHandle);
00318 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00319         ftdi_usb_purge_buffers(ftHandle);
00320         ftdi_disable_bitbang(ftHandle);
00321         ftdi_free(ftHandle);
00322 #endif
00323     }
00324 }

00327 /*******************************************************************************
00328  * Functions that can only be used within this file.
00329  */
00330 
00331 
00332 /**
00333  * Converts bytes of data to serial form to send over SPI. Each bit is converted
00334  * to two bytes, 1 to set the data, and the second to toggle SCK. The bit is set
00335  * on the rising edge of the clock.
00336  *
00337  * @param bytes bytes to convert to serial. If this is NULL, then MOSI is set to
00338  *     0 for all bits.
00339  * @param[out] serialData where to store serial SPI data. Must be at least
00340  *     size * 16 bytes in size.
00341  * @param size how many bytes to convert to serial form.
00342  **/
00343 void serialiseMosi(const uint8_t* bytes, uint8_t* serialData, uint32_t size)
00344 {
00345     uint8_t mosiBit;
00346     uint8_t singleByte;
00347     uint32_t i;
00348     uint8_t j;
00349 
00350     /* Loop through all bytes */
00351     for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00352         /* Use 0 for the value if bytes is not present */
00353         singleByte = (bytes != NULL) ? *bytes++ : 0;
00354 
00355         /* Loop through each bit in the byte */
00356         for (j = 0x80; j > 0; j >>= 1) {
00357             /* Set MOSI high, if the bit is set in the byte, and clear SCK */
00358             mosiBit = (singleByte & j) ? mosi : 0;
00359 
00360             *serialData++ = mosiBit;
00361 
00362             /* Set SCK high */
00363             *serialData++ = mosiBit | sck;
00364 
00365         }
00366     }
00367 }
00368 
00369 
00370 /**
00371  * Converts data read from SPI into bytes of data. Two serial bytes are
00372  * converted to a single MISO bit. The bit is read on the rising edge of SCK.
00373  *
00374  * @param serialData serial SPI data to convert to bytes.
00375  * @param[out] bytes where to store bytes. Must be at least count / 16 bytes in
00376  *     size.
00377  * @param size size of serialData, multiple of 16.
00378  * @return @c true if no errors, @c false if SCK is not toggling
00379  *     correctly in serialData.
00380  **/
00381 bool deserialiseMiso(const uint8_t* serialData, uint8_t* bytes, uint32_t size)
00382 {
00383     uint8_t* endPtr = bytes + (size / 16);
00384     uint8_t j;
00385     bool isError = false;
00386 
00387     /* Loop through all bytes */
00388     for ( ; bytes < endPtr; bytes++) {
00389         /* Initialise byte to 0 so binary OR can be used to set bits */
00390         *bytes = 0;
00391 
00392         /* Loop through each bit in the byte */
00393         for (j = 0x80; j > 0; j >>= 1) {
00394             /* SCK should be 0 here */
00395             if (*serialData++ & sck) {
00396                 isError = true;
00397             }
00398 
00399             /* Set bit in byte */
00400             *bytes |= (*serialData & miso) ? j : 0;
00401 
00402             /* SCK should be 1 here */
00403             if (!(*serialData++ & sck)) {
00404                 isError = true;
00405             }
00406         }
00407     }
00408 
00409     return !isError;
00410 }
00411 
00412 
00413 /**
00414  * Writes and reads back a number of bytes from FT232R. This is not limited by
00415  * maximum communication size.
00416  *
00417  * @param writeData pointer to bytes to write.
00418  * @param[out] readData where to store read bytes.
00419  * @param size how many bytes to write and optionally read.
00420  **/
00421 void bitBang(const uint8_t* writeData, uint8_t* readData, uint32_t size)
00422 {
00423     /* Split data up if it is too big and call bitBangBlock() */
00424     while (size > MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1) {
00425         bitBangBlock(writeData, readData, MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1);
00426         writeData += MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1;
00427         readData += MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1;
00428         size -= MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1;
00429     }
00430     bitBangBlock(writeData, readData, size);
00431 }
00432 
00433 
00434 /**
00435  * Writes and reads back a number of bytes from FT232R. This function should
00436  * only be called by @c bitBang().
00437  *
00438  * Every time a byte is written the previous values are read from the pins
00439  * and placed in the RX buffer. Therefore this buffer should be cleared, if
00440  * it is not going to be read, to avoid messing up later communication.
00441  * If the RX buffer is going to be read, and aligned with the data that has
00442  * been written, a dummy byte is written so that the last byte of
00443  * real data can be read back. And the first byte read back is
00444  * ignored as it will have pin values from an earlier operation.
00445  *
00446  * @param writeData pointer to bytes to write.
00447  * @param[out] readData where to store read bytes.
00448  * @param size how many bytes to write and optionally read. MUST be less than
00449  *     @c MAX_FT_COMM_SIZE - 1
00450  **/
00451 void bitBangBlock(const uint8_t* writeData, uint8_t* readData, uint32_t size)
00452 {
00453     uint8_t* outData;
00454     uint8_t* inData;
00455     uint32_t writeSize = size + 1;
00456     int32_t status = 0;
00457 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00458     uint32_t bytesWritten;
00459     uint32_t bytesRead = 0;
00460 #endif
00461 
00462     outData = (uint8_t*)malloc(size + 1);
00463     inData = (uint8_t*)malloc(size + 1);
00464     if (outData == NULL || inData == NULL) {
00465         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Could not allocate %u bytes at %s.\n",
00466                 size + 1, LOC);
00467         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00468     }
00469 
00470     /*
00471      * Create data that will be written, with added "dummy" byte (same pin
00472      * values as the last "real" byte).
00473      */
00474     memmove(outData, writeData, size);
00475     outData[size] = outData[size - 1];
00476 
00477     /* Write all bytes and wait for write to finish */
00478 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00479     status = FT_Write(ftHandle, (LPVOID)outData , writeSize,
00480                                                          (DWORD*)&bytesWritten);
00481     if (bytesWritten != writeSize) {
00482             fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Only wrote %u bytes of %u (%s).\n",
00483                     bytesWritten, writeSize, stripPath(LOC));
00484         free(inData);
00485         free(outData);
00486         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00487     }
00488 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00489     status = ftdi_write_data(ftHandle, outData, writeSize);
00490 #endif
00491     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00492 
00493     /* Read back bytes */
00494 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00495     status = FT_Read(ftHandle, (LPVOID)inData, writeSize, (DWORD*)&bytesRead);
00496     if (bytesRead != writeSize) {
00497         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Only read %u bytes of %u (%s).\n",
00498                 bytesRead, writeSize, stripPath(LOC));
00499         free(outData);
00500         free(inData);
00501         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00502     }
00503 
00504 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00505     status = ftdi_read_data(ftHandle, inData, writeSize);
00506 #endif
00507     checkFtError(status, LOC);
00508 
00509     memmove(readData, inData + 1, size);
00510 
00511     free(inData);
00512     free(outData);
00513 }
00514 
00515 
00516 /**
00517  * This function should be called with the return code from every Ft function.
00518  * If there's an error, it's printed out and the program exits.
00519  *
00520  * @param code error code.
00521  * @param location filename and line number from where function is called.
00522  **/
00523 void checkFtError(int32_t code, const char* location)
00524 {
00525 #if defined (FTDI_USE_D2XX)
00526     if (code == FT_OK) return;      /* No error */
00527     if (code <= FT_OTHER_ERROR) {
00528         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: %s at %s\n",
00529                 ftErrorStrings[code], stripPath(location));
00530         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00531     }
00532     else {
00533         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: FT:%i at %s\n", code, stripPath(location));
00534         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00535     }
00536 #elif defined (FTDI_USE_LIBUSB)
00537     if (code < 0) {
00538         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR %i: %s at %s\n", code,
00539                 ftdi_get_error_string(ftHandle), stripPath(location));
00540         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00541     }
00542 #endif
00543 }
Generated on Wed Jan 27 18:17:54 2010 for Tyndall USB Programmer by  1.6.1
